DataElement.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery 32 Safe to Stand Five Times Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not conditions were safe for participant to stand five times during the repeated chair stand test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test SPPB Version 1.2 - Safe to Stand Five Times Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Short Physical Performance Battery V1.2 (SPPB V1.2) (Guralnik JM, Ferrucci L, Pieper CF, Leveille SG, Markides KS, Ostir GV, Studenski S, Berkman LF, Wallace RB. Lower extremity function and subsequent disability: consistency across studies, predictive models, and value of gait speed alone compared with the short physical performance battery. J Gerontol A Biol Sci Med Sci 2000 April;55(4):M221-M231)._Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 (SPPB Version 1.2) Chair Stand Test - Repeated Chair Stand Test: Safe to stand five times._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.longName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test
Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item 10-minute assessment tool, developed by Guralnik et al. 1994, that is used for the evaluation of lower extremity physical function and consists of three subtests, including standing balance, walking, and rising from a chair.
